seo.metaTitle: NWA Daily - A daily newsletter about all things Northwest Arkansas
seo.metaDescription: NWA Daily is a daily email newsletter that keeps readers up to date on the latest Northwest Arkansas news or NWA news in events, restaurants, business,  the community, politics, art, entertainment, culture, and sports in Northwest Arkansas including news about Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, and Fayetteville

posts.title: Cool Jobs in NWA
posts.content:
Looking for a job? Check out these positions posted to our community board:

  • Downtown Bentonville Inc. is looking for a Bentonville Farmers Market Manager*
  • Ropeswing Hospitality Group has an opening for a Human Resources Generalist.

Have a job you're looking to fill? Post it HERE!

posts.title: NWA Start-Up TrueRep Helps Fitness Enthusiasts Squat with Precision
posts.content:
Ozark Apps Development, a software consulting firm based in Northwest Arkansas, is helping people get strong and stay safe with their app TrueRep, that provides real-time feedback to users performing squats.

  • Don't skip leg day: TrueRep helps users maintain proper form when squatting, providing real-time alerts and pose estimation on camera, This allows lifters to adjust during their squats, rather than waiting for a sore back to tell them they had incorrect form the next day.
  • Worldwide adoption: With Guerrilla marketing tactics, TrueRep is gaining traction all over the world from Kuwait to France!

Learn more about TrueRep in this article from TB&P here.

posts.title: U of A Researchers Take to the Sky with Hybrid Electric Aircraft and Motor Drive Technology
posts.content:
The University of Arkansas has achieved a major milestone in its ambitious project to design and develop battery-powered motor drives for aircraft, with a successful test flight of their electric motor drive on a hybrid electric aircraft on Feb 20.

  • Gearing up for flight: Collaborating with Ampaire, Wolfspeed, and the University of Illinois, U of A researchers designed a 250-kilowatt motor drive to power a rear electrical engine in the aircraft.
  • Electric feel: With their successful test flight, the U of A researchers' project could lead to significant changes in the aeronautics industry, with huge benefits to environmental quality, as electric-powered aircraft replace gas-guzzling engines.

Find more on the story here.

posts.title: Arkansas's NCAA Tournament Run Ends in Sweet 16 Against UConn
posts.content:
Arkansas's NCAA Tournament run ended in the Sweet 16 after an 88-65 loss to UConn.

  • Hot shooting: Despite Anthony Black's 20 points, the Razorbacks couldn't match UConn's 57.4% shooting, 42 points in the paint, and strong offensive performance with 22 assists.
  • Sweet 16 streak: The Razorbacks' third consecutive Sweet 16 appearance capped off the season with a 22-14 record.

Congrats to the team for another great season under Musselman's leadership - we're already looking forward to next year! Read more about the game here.

posts.title: Weekend Roundup
posts.content:
Happy Friday - either you're on spring break or the only one in the office. If it's the latter, you probably have some time on your hands to contemplate what you're doing this weekend. Here are some of our ideas:

  • At bat: No. 17 Lady Razorbacks Softball team welcomes No. 10 Florida this weekend for a three game series at home. This will be their 66th meeting against each other.
  • On the hunt: This Sunday the Ozark Foundation is hosting their annual, kid-friendly Trailcat Challenge in Bentonville.
  • On beat: Plenty of live music happening across NWA including shows in Winslow, Bentonville, and Eureka.
  • Arts and crafts: Free Spring Break events are happening throughout the weekend at Crystal Bridges in Bentonville.
  • A necessity: The one day special performance of The Jungle Book is Saturday at the Walton Arts Center.
  • Shop local: Ozark Beer Company in Rogers is hosting the Ozark's Spring Market on Saturday from 1-5p.
  • Once more: Tomorrow is the final day of Fayetteville's Spring Fling farmers market at the downtown square.

Have a wonderful weekend and we will talk to you Monday!

posts.title: True Colors Tulips Farm Set to Open in April Despite Cold Snap
posts.content:
True Colors Farm, a Bentonville-based u-pick tulip farm, prepared for the 2023 season by planting 120,000 bulbs in its tulip field. The farm, which is set to open in mid-April, is the first of its kind in Northwest Arkansas and promises its biggest season yet.

  • Beautiful and purposeful: The farm is not only a sight to behold, but also serves a larger purpose of educating the public about gaps in opportunities for adults with differences, with its proceeds from the season going to Perspectability, a non-profit aimed at providing resources and support.
  • A special experience: The farm is open to the public, charging an admission fee and a small fee for each tulip picked, and is staffed by neurodiverse workers during its customer-picking season.

Read more on the story here.

posts.title: Get Down and Derby at Equestrian Bridges' Mini Derby Fundraiser
posts.content:
Equestrian Bridges will bring a bit of Churchill Downs to Rogers during the 11th Annual Mini Derby fundraiser, set for Saturday, May 6, from 4-8p. 

  • Fun-sized Kentucky Derby: This adults-only event will include a Kentucky Derby watch party, live music by Dial Up, miniature horse races, mint juleps, a silent auction, and more. Guests are encouraged to dress in traditional derby attire with prizes awarded for best hat, best bow tie, and best overall dressed. 
  • Race on: Presented by the Sazerac Company, 100% of the proceeds will support Equestrian Bridges’ mission to provide equine therapy to those in need in Northwest Arkansas.

Reserve your tickets for the Mini Derby HERE.

posts.title: Famous Hardware Building in Springdale to Feature Blanka Amezkua's Installation
posts.content:
CACHE and the Tyson Family Foundation have commissioned artist Blanka Amezkua for the next Downtown Springdale art installation at the Famous Hardware Building.

  • A cure for present ailments: The installation, Hierbitas de saberes (Tiny herbs of knowledge), is inspired by the oldest medical text crafted in the Americas, the Codex de la Cruz-Badiano, which shares the joy of the arrival of spring and the rich botanical diversity in Mexico.
  • Vibrant, visible: The installation is visible from the sidewalk and features the flower illustrations found inside the Codex. It will be in place through Jun 5, with an accompanying artist talk on Apr 28 at The Medium.

Read more on the installation here.

posts.title: Heroes Coffee Announces Plans To Open New Location Next To Ramen Nara in Rogers
posts.content:
Heroes Coffee has big news brewing – a new location coming right next to Ramen Nara! The popular Roastery & Cafe, currently in downtown Bentonville and the Pinnacle area of Rogers, offers a unique menu of coffee drinks, teas, smoothies and snacks sure to satisfy.

  • Caffeinated creations: Heroes' signature lattes come hot or cold in flavors like German Chocolate Cake, Peanut Butter Cup, Raspberry Turtle and Honey Salted Caramel.
  • Something for everyone: In addition to coffee, smoothies and tea, they also offer oats, muffins, scones, gluten-free banana bread, gluten-free pumpkin bread, cookies and more!

Stay tuned for more details on the new location here.

posts.title: Dave and Jenny Marrs' "Marrs Mercantile" Set to Open in Centerton
posts.content:
Stars of the wildly popular HGTV show Fixer to Fabulous, Dave & Jenny Marrs, are making their mark on Centerton with the opening of their general store Marrs Mercantile.

  • Good bones: This historic space opened as a bank in 1905 and has now been transformed into a retail store that features locally sourced goods and brand favorites featured on the show.
  • The reveal: The Marrs Mercantile grand opening will take place on Apr 1 with a ribbon-cutting ceremony, an autograph session with Dave & Jenny, and plenty of music and food trucks.

Get the full story here.

posts.title: Noon2Moon Endurance MTB Race Returns To Coler
posts.content:
Noon2Moon, Coler Mountain Bike Preserve’s Second Annual endurance race, returns to Bentonville on Saturday, May 6, with the 12-hr race beginning at 8a and the 6-hr race at 12p. 

  • Til the sun sets: Riders can race solo or as a team, and those who complete the most laps in their category will be awarded prizes and medals. The community is invited to cheer the riders on (or heckle them), and cowbells and costumes are highly encouraged! 
  • In the biking business: Join this year’s new Corporate Challenge and race with your business teammates against other local companies for bragging rights while giving back; proceeds from the event support Coler Mountain Bike Preserve’s trails and community programs. 

Register to race solo or as a team here.

posts.title: Mortgage Lending in NWA Sees Steep Decline Amid Inflation-Fueled Interest Rate Increases
posts.content:
After a series of rate increases to combat inflation and subsequent increases in home-loan rates, mortgage lending has reportedly slowed down in Northwest Arkansas.

  • Declining trend: Attom Data Solutions' fourth quarter mortgage report for Arkansas shows a decrease of 24.9% in the Northwest Arkansas area from the previous quarter, and a year-over-year drop of 50.1%.
  • Statewide slump: The report shows a similar decrease in mortgages originated in central Arkansas and the Fort Smith metro area, each with a quarterly decline of 14.6% and 25.6% respectively, and 62.5% and 53.2% decreases year-over-year.

Read the full report here.

posts.title: Arkansas Tourism Shows Resiliency as Revenue and Job Gains Outpace Inflation
posts.content:
Arkansas's Tourism Ticker for 2022 by TB&P is out, and it's looking good for the travel and tourism sector.

  • Big ups: Benton County had a whopping 51.8% increase in tourism tax collections, while Washington County came in at a 36.2% increase over 2021, both outsized gains compared to other counties included in the report.
  • Jobs on track: The tourism sector in Northwest Arkansas saw monthly average employment of 27,010 in 2022, a 3.8% increase compared to the same period in 2021 and actually a smaller increase than other regions in the state.

Read the full Arkansas Tourism Ticker report here.

posts.title: Tupelo Honey Southern Kitchen & Bar Signs Lease at Pinnacle Springs in Rogers
posts.content:
Tupelo Honey Southern Kitchen & Bar is reportedly coming to Rogers in late 2024, bringing with it a revival of authentic Southern dishes like honey-dusted fried chicken, shrimp and grits, and chicken and waffles.

  • NC roots: Based in Asheville, Tupelo Honey has been serving up Southern favorites since 2000 and has 20 locations nationwide.
  • ICYMI: Part of a mixed-use center anchored by Whole Foods Market, Firebirds Wood Fired Grill will also be joining the restaurant scene at Pinnacle Springs.

Find more on this story here.

posts.title: Walmart AMP Transitions to Digital Tickets
posts.content:
The AMP is going digital in 2023, with digital tickets as the default delivery method for all performance tickets.

  • What's in your wallet? Digital tickets will be conveniently delivered to your ticket wallet, accessible on a smartphone once your purchase is made.
  • Countermeasures: Utilizing a rotating QR code will help ensure that tickets aren't counterfeited while still allowing holders to prove that they have a valid ticket.

Read more about this change here.

posts.title: Pinnacle Springs Project in Rogers Adds a New Restaurant Tenant
posts.content:
The Pinnacle Springs development in Rogers is getting its first restaurant tenant with North Carolina-based Firebirds Wood Fired Grill, an American cuisine concept serving up steak, seafood, and other signature dishes.

  • Flame up: Firebirds Wood Fired Grill, with approximately 60 U.S. locations, will open its first Arkansas location in the fourth quarter of 2024.
  • Developed: The development also includes a 350-unit apartment complex and two office buildings totaling about 29,000 square feet.

Read the full article here.

posts.title: Get Ready For The Amazeum's UnGala FUNdraiser
posts.content:
Play like a kid, eat, drink, and raise money for a great cause at the Scott Family Amazeum’s UnGala, an annual FUNdraiser for ages 21+ where you can experience one-of-a-kind activities that spark creativity and curiosity, on Apr 21, from 6-10p.

  • Kidding around: Try pewter casting, screen printing, and other cool hands-on activities, or if you have a need for speed, you can race others in a souped-up, 24-volt racer. There will also be an all-you-can-eat food truck buffet and a mad-scientist cocktail round!
  • Play with purpose: Thanks to the UnGala, the Amazeum can continue its nonprofit mission by hosting Priceless Nights, keeping the cost of general admission low, and providing professional development opportunities for local educators.

Prepare to unleash your creativity and get your tickets HERE.
posts.topic: Sponsored by the Scott Family Amazeum

posts.title: Danny Collins Takes Adventure Racers on a Wild Ride Through Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
I am Northwest Arkansas recently featured Danny Collins, the founder of 37 North Expeditions and the director of the upcoming Expedition Ozark race.

  • Exploring Ozarks: Adventure racers from 10 countries are competing in a five-day, 375-mile race that will take them through the breathtaking Ozarks.
  • Get outside: 37 North Expeditions curates exceptional outdoor experiences, providing the equipment and transportation, and taking the planning steps out for corporate groups looking for team bonding opportunities post-COVID.

Learn more about Expedition Ozark and Danny Collins' 37 North Expeditions here.

posts.title: WSJ Highlights Northwest Arkansas's Booming Growth
posts.content:
The WSJ recently highlighted Northwest Arkansas's drastic transformation in the last few years. This growth can be partly attributed to initiatives by notable companies, foundations, and programs like the Northwest Arkansas Council’s Life Works Here.

  • Job opportunities: Companies like Walmart, Tyson Foods, J.B. Hunt Transport, and many others have been creating more and more job opportunities in the area.
  • The times they are a changin': Residents are drawn in by affordable housing, a small-town feel, outdoor activities, and city-like amenities. However, with its population projected to rise by over 300,000 over the next twenty years, the area's housing costs have seen a marked increase.

Read the full highlight here.

posts.title: Springdale Residents to Vote on Bond Issues that Could Fund City Projects
posts.content:
Voters in Springdale will make decisions in a May 9 special bond election that could fund various improvement projects in the city.

  • Bonding structure: The bond change will allow the city to restructure bonds for the purpose of funding projects including updating parks, transportation, and infrastructure, a new fire station, and a 40,000 square foot senior center.
  • Taxes and levy: Sales taxes for the city would remain at 2%, and the City of Springdale can also levy a 1% local sales and use tax that will cover the cost of the bonds when they are paid off.

Find more on the story here.

posts.title: Go Into the Jungle in NWA Through The Jungle Book Collaborative Performance
posts.content:
Experience the strength of the jungle in The Jungle Book, a collaboration between Trike Theatre, Ra-Ve Cultural Foundation, and Megha Rao of Dhirana Dance for an original adaptation of the beloved tale.

  • Perfect mixture: Mixing theatrical storytelling with classical Indian dance, The Jungle Book follows Mowgli's journey to trust her community instead of going alone.
  • Local talent: Featuring talented youth actors and dancers from across NWA, this engaging performance combines professional production, local talent, and an all-time favorite fable.

Mark your calendars for Mar 25 at 4pm, and get your tickets here.

posts.title: CRISP & GREEN Announces Opening of First Arkansas Location in Bentonville
posts.content:
Healthy, fast-casual restaurant, CRISP & GREEN, is set to open its first Arkansas location in Bentonville this April. Founded in 2016, The restaurant serves up nutritious and delicious bowls, salads, smoothies, and more, made with sustainably and consciously sourced ingredients.

  • Committed to community: In addition to great food, the restaurant partners with local fitness experts to provide complimentary classes and looks forward to becoming an integral part of Bentonville's health-conscious and active community.
  • Rapid expansion: Encouraged by growing consumer demand for healthy and convenient food options, CRISP & GREEN is planning five locations across Arkansas and is on track to double its presence, with locations in 15 states in 2023.

Keep up with the new location here.

posts.title: Razorbacks Clinch Sweet 16 Bid with Victory Over 1 Seed Kansas
posts.content:
The Arkansas Razorbacks advanced to the program’s 14th Sweet 16 with a win over Kansas on Saturday, despite being down 12 points in the second half. Devo Davis was instrumental in the comeback, scoring 25 points, and Ricky Council IV sealed the victory with his last five points from the line.

  • No. 1 seed? No problem: This is the third year in a row Arkansas has faced a top-seeded team, bringing their record to 2-1 in these matchups in that timeframe. In the 2022 Sweet 16, the Razorbacks upset Gonzaga and cut Kansas' dance short in the second round of the 2021 tourney.
  • 6th man: Jordan Walsh came off the bench and went for 10 points and three rebounds. Kamani Johnson also had 10 boards and a putback late.

Relive the epic win here and watch Musselman show off his muscles here.

posts.title: Budget-Friendly Activities for Spring Break in Arkansas
posts.content:
If you aren't traveling anywhere for Spring Break this week, the Natural State offers families plenty of budget-friendly activities to enjoy close to home. Get your kids away from the screens and out into the great outdoors with these fun ideas.

  • Wild & Free: Spend a day birdwatching or exploring Arkansas' 1800+ miles of public hiking trails. You can also hop on a bike and explore local bike trails or paths.
  • Educational & Entertaining: Visit one of the many free or paid museums, visit a historic theater, or take to the stars on a camping adventure.

Check out the full guide from Only in Arkansas here.

posts.title: Crystal Bridges Has Something for Everyone This Spring Break
posts.content:
Crystal Bridges has something for everyone this Spring Break! Explore 120 acres of Ozark forest, with trails, galleries, art classes, and more.

  • Party on: Spring Break week kicked off with Pintura Fest this past Saturday, which included family-friendly activities, live painting, performances, and more.
  • There's more: With the opening party out of the way, there's still more fun to be had the rest of the week. You'll be able to explore Diego Rivera's vision of America, enjoy live performances, go through an obstacle course, learn from artist demos, and more!

Learn more about the museum here.

node.content:
Crêpes Paulette, founded by Bentonville native Paula Jo Chitty Henry and her French husband Frédéric Henry, has been delighting the taste buds of Northwest Arkansas since 2010. Starting as a food truck on the Bentonville Square, they have successfully expanded their culinary offerings and have since opened a brick-and-mortar restaurant in 2016. At Crêpes Paulette, you can expect delicious, innovative, and fast-casual spins on various cuisines, all wrapped in their traditional, authentic French crêpes and galettes.

Crepes Paulette

Innovative Menu and Quality Ingredients

Each handheld creation is made fresh to order, featuring quality ingredients, proprietary recipes, and attention to detail. From their classic Nutella banana sweet crêpe to their wildly popular gluten-free Thai savory crepe, the menu caters to a variety of tastes and dietary preferences.

Eco-Friendly and Community-Oriented

Crêpes Paulette is committed to minimizing packaging and food waste, recycling, and participating in fundraisers for the Northwest Arkansas community and beyond. With the opening of their brick-and-mortar restaurant, they've continued these efforts while expanding their offerings, maintaining the lighthearted and friendly atmosphere cultivated at the food truck.

Tips from the Locals

If you're visiting Bentonville and looking for a delightful crêpe experience, here are some recommendations:

  1. For the classic "French" experience: La Complète (savory); Nutella and banana (sweet)
  2. For the vegetarian: La Centrale or La Veggie Thai
  3. For the meat lover: La Bête
  4. For the hard-core sweet tooth: La Turtle

Wrap-Up

Crêpes Paulette is the perfect spot for anyone looking to indulge in the art of authentic French crêpes in Bentonville, Arkansas. Whether you visit their food truck or their brick-and-mortar restaurant, you're sure to enjoy a memorable culinary experience. So, why not stop by one of their locations soon and immerse yourself in the delightful world of Crêpes Paulette?
node.title: Crêpes Paulette: The Art of Authentic French Crêpes in Bentonville, Arkansas

node.content:
After a week's worth of snow and ice began to melt, the Washington County Fairgrounds turned into quite the mud pit, but that didn't stop nearly a thousand local beer enthusiasts from descending upon the Washington County Fairgrounds for the 2023 Frost Fest.

The winter beer festival, presented by Fossil Cover Brewing Co, brought over 55 breweries from across eight states to Fayetteville, where they got to highlight and share samples of their best brews.

A fleet of local food trucks rolled out with great eats for festivalgoers. Local artisans and businesses came to the event to connect with the public and display their products and services, and rocking out on stage were The Phlegms, Vintage Pistol, and Nick Shoulders & Okay Crawdad.

Beyond enjoying great beer and local businesses, it was a blast getting to see friends from all over Northwest Arkansas gathering to raise a glass to good times and great beer with big smiles on their faces.

Great work Fossil Cove. We can't wait for next year!
node.title: Frost Fest 2023 Photo Recap

node.content:
Tucked away in the heart of downtown Rogers, Arkansas, The Welcome Inn offers an experience of a peaceful getaway in a historic and charming setting. This 1870's house has been lovingly restored by Dave and Jenny Marrs, the stars of HGTV's Fixer to Fabulous. Whether you're looking for a relaxing weekend with friends or a cozy family vacation, this beautifully designed retreat can comfortably accommodate up to 8 people in its 3 elegant bedrooms, each with its own en suite bathroom.

Airbnb

Booking Your Stay

Begin your enchanting journey by reserving the entire house through Airbnb on a rolling 12-month basis, with stays starting on May 4th, 2022. Note that there is a 2-night minimum stay for all reservations and bookings can only start on Monday, Wednesday, or Friday.

Amenities and Features

The Welcome Inn boasts an array of features and amenities to make your stay truly memorable:

  1. The Living Room - A light and airy space exuding casual elegance
  2. The Dining Room & Kitchen - Perfect for intimate dinners and family gatherings
  3. The Bourbon Room - A club atmosphere with luxurious leather chairs
  4. The Wine Cellar - A brick-floored cellar with seating for 10 around a large wine tasting table
  5. The Smokehouse - A separate building for dining, games, and relaxation, complete with a Yoders Smokers outdoor grill

Recreational activities at The Welcome Inn include an Apple TV 4K in the living room, Wi-Fi, board games, puzzles, books, and outdoor games.

The Inn also prioritizes your comfort and safety, offering complete laundry facilities, heating and cooling, smoke and carbon monoxide alarms, a fire suppression system, first aid kit, and outdoor security cameras.

The Story of The Welcome Inn

The Welcome Inn, originally built by the King family on a 160-acre working farm, has been home to only four previous owners over the past 150 years. The extensive restoration process took just under a year, addressing issues such as rot, termite damage, bee infestations, and updating electrical and plumbing systems.

Community Impact

Dave and Jenny Marrs have partnered with a local nonprofit organization, @savinggracenwa, to create a hospitality training program for young women who have aged out of foster care or are facing homelessness. By working at The Welcome Inn, these young women have the opportunity to change their lives while caring for the home, gardens, guests, and chickens.

Wrap-Up

The Welcome Inn is more than just a beautiful retreat – it's a place where history, hospitality, and community come together. Experience the charm and serenity of this unique getaway in Rogers, Arkansas, and make memories that will last a lifetime. We look forward to welcoming you at The Welcome Inn.
node.title: Discover the Charm of The Welcome Inn in Rogers, Arkansas

node.content:
Heirloom at the 1907 is a hidden gem located in the heart of Downtown Rogers. Tucked away in the Onyx Headquarters, this restaurant is a true oasis for foodies and those seeking a unique dining experience. From the moment you make your reservation, you know you're in for something special.

The atmosphere of Heirloom is truly one-of-a-kind. Danielle Ribuado and her team have mastered the art of hospitality, making sure that every single detail is taken care of. From the playlist in the background, to the personalized service, they have created an environment where you can truly relax and enjoy your meal.

But the real star of the show is the food. Chef Jason Paul has created a rotating prix fixe menu that takes you on a culinary journey. Every 4-6 weeks, the menu changes, giving diners the opportunity to experience something new and exciting with each visit. The restaurant seats only 20 people and is open for reservations only 3-4 nights a week. This ensures that each patron receives the highest quality experience possible.

Reservations for Heirloom drop on the 15th of each month, and they book up quickly. If you're unable to secure a reservation, you can always join the waitlist. But trust me, the wait is well worth it.

As soon as you step through the doors of Heirloom, you're transported to a different world. The atmosphere is intimate and cozy, with a warm and inviting ambiance. The staff is attentive and friendly, making sure that you have everything you need to enjoy your meal.

The food is absolutely outstanding. Chef Jason Paul has created a menu that is both innovative and delicious. The flavors are bold and complex, and the presentation is beautiful. Each course is thoughtfully curated, and the progression of flavors is expertly executed.

The prix fixe menu changes every 4-6 weeks, which means that each visit is a new and exciting experience. You never know what culinary creations will be on the menu, but you can be sure that they will be delicious. The variety of flavors and textures is truly amazing, and it's a pleasure to see how Chef Jason Paul is able to take simple ingredients and elevate them to a new level.

The restaurant seats only 20 people, which means that it's an intimate and cozy dining experience. The small size of the restaurant also ensures that each patron receives the highest quality experience possible. The service is personalized and attentive, and the staff is always happy to answer any questions you may have.

In conclusion, Heirloom at the 1907 is a hidden gem that is not to be missed. The atmosphere, the food, and the service are all outstanding, and it's a pleasure to dine in such a unique and special place. If you're looking for a truly memorable dining experience, make sure to book a reservation at Heirloom.
node.title: Unforgettable Dining at Heirloom at the 1907: A Hidden Gem in Downtown Rogers, Arkansas

node.content:
Northwest Arkansas is leading the state in many ways with its active plans for clean energy, its elevating tech scene, its strong foothold in advanced air mobility, and its mountain biking infrastructure. Among the array of reasons NWA is a great place to be, the region is also making moves to be known for its approach to holistic health. 

Photo courtesy of Andrea Piacquadio

Already, institutions like the University of Health and Performance, the Children's Safety Center, and the Whole Health Institute create environments where the priority and emphasis are on the health of the whole person. The region's latest endeavor to make NWA an epicenter of holistic health is the Alice L. Walton School of Medicine, which is working to combine conventional medicine with integrative techniques and principles. Emotional and mental health is top of mind right now for many people and is an essential part of the well-rounded nature of a healthy community. 

Photo courtesy of Tirachard Kumtanom

While new initiatives are happening, there are already several organizations in NWA for counseling and therapy of all kinds. One of the hardest things sometimes, we think, is how many options there are. So the team at NWA Daily has done some research to narrow down 13 counseling options in the region to create a resource for your mental and emotional health journey.

Photo courtesy of Alex Green

In order by location:

1. Psychology and Counseling Associates

1 W. Sunbridge Dr., Fayetteville

5434 W Walsh Ln., Rogers

Psychology and Counseling Associates has been voted Best Mental Health Clinic for 10 years in a row. It has an office in Fayetteville and Rogers and offers services for ADHD/Learning Difficulties, Alcohol Use Disorder, Anxiety, Depression, Marital Therapy, PTSD, Sexual Health, Eating Disorders, and more. 

Fayetteville: 479.443.5575

Rogers: 479.442.2311

2. Talk Center Counseling Services

130 N College Ave, Fayetteville

Talk Center Counseling strives to help people find their sense of wholeness. Their licensed professional counselors and social service workers serve adults, families, teens, and children. Talk Center Counseling also offers group therapy for teenage girls and a yoga group for those suffering from anxiety.

479.396.8806

3. The Joshua Center

3680 N. Investment Dr, Fayetteville

2105 S. 54th St, Rogers

920 S. Caroline St, Siloam Springs

The Joshua Center offers individual adult therapy, therapy for children, adolescents, and families, couples therapy, pre-marital counseling, and discernment work. The center utilizes different approaches such as emotionally-focused therapy, play therapy, EMDR, brain spotting, and others. 

Fayetteville: 479.435.9356

Rogers: 479.268.4557

Siloam Springs: 479.373.2377

4. Midtown Counseling

1845 Green Acres Rd, Fayetteville

 Midtown Counseling provides counseling services and specialized evaluations to individuals, families, and groups. They accept most major insurance providers and are certified by the Arkansas Board of Examiners in Counseling, the National Board of Certified Counselors, and the American Counseling Association.

479.957.8546

Photo courtesy of cottonbro

5. Pinnacle Counseling 

5500 W Pinnacle Pointe Dr, Rogers

Pinnacle Counseling has been serving the Rogers area for 15 plus years with client-centered approaches to anxiety, depression, marriage and family counseling, etc. Pinnacle Counseling counselors help their clients find empowerment and clarity to achieve their wellness goals. 

479.282.2443

6. Oaks Counseling

6815 Isaac's Orchard Rd, Springdale

Oaks Counseling is a group of trained and certified counselors with decades of combined experience who are fully equipped to help you process whatever it is you need to move toward a healthier life. 

7. Professional Counseling Services of NWA

6801 Isaac's Orchard Rd, Springdale

Professional Counseling Services of NWA specialize in individual counseling, stress management, clinical hypnosis, and professional life coaching. At Professional Counseling Services of NWA, you are the expert of your own life, collaborating with an expert in counseling to find solution-focused, individualized goals and treatments for your issues. 

479.799.5577

8. Brookway Counseling

801 Carlton St, Springdale

Brookway Counseling has a team of qualified and experienced counselors specializing in depression and anxiety counseling, ADHD, EMDR therapy, Christian counseling, psychological testing, eating disorders, marriage and family counseling, and online teletherapy.

479.255.5414

9. NWA Premier Therapy

2103 S 54th St, Rogers

NWA Premier Therapy specializes in trauma-focused counseling, though they also offer play therapy, therapy for those struggling with HSP issues, therapy for LGBTQIA+ individuals, grief counseling, and much more.

479.372.7446

479.389.8188 (text)

Photo courtesy of SHVETS

10. Fresh Roots Counseling

3901 W Financial Pkwy, Rogers

Fresh Roots Family Counseling has been serving the NWA community since 1995. They have a team of 20+ licensed professional counselors specializing in many therapy areas. Some techniques that make Fresh Roots stand out are Emotion-Focused couples therapy, EMDR, play therapy, co-parenting counseling, and Sexual Addiction Therapy.

479.986.8655

11. Bentonville Counseling Collective

2104 SE 14th St, Bentonville

Bentonville Counseling Collective offers counseling services to all those wanting to make a positive change in their lives. They specialize in relationship counseling, gender transition counseling, expressive arts therapy, therapy for therapists, telehealth video counseling, and trauma-informed therapy.

479.310.6850

12. Creative Counseling Center

902 McClain Rd, Bentonville

The counselors of the Creative Counseling Center of NWA have created a space of casual, confidential, and collaborative conversation to aid you on your healing journey. They offer services to individuals and couples for a wide variety of issues. 

479.364.0075

13. Soul Talk Therapy

900 SE 5th St, Bentonville

Soul Talk Therapy is in a quaint, comfortable space with dedicated counselors cultivating safe environments to explore thoughts, feelings, and experiences without any threat of judgment. 

479.888.5546

Photo courtesy of Alex Green

If you're still looking to find free and affordable counseling near you, or you want to learn more about what is available, check out opencounseling.com. For tips on how to find a counselor fit for you in NWA, read this blog post from Fresh Roots Family Counseling.
